intro: Thrinax radiata, commonly known as the bottle tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is characterized by its thick, cylindrical trunk that stores water, making it well adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the dry season. Its leaves are narrow and clustered at the base of the trunk, reducing water loss through transpiration. Thrinax radiata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
